metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16227 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The aspath_put function in bgpd/bgp_aspath.c in Quagga before 1.2.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (session drop) via BGP UPDATE messages, because AS_PATH size calculation for long paths counts certain bytes twice and consequently constructs an invalid message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16227` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

quagga - 0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: quagga package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.3').
